means: 渴望的，有抱负的，追求名誉或地位的
有志向或渴望获得…的人

sentence.Network_en: Any aspirant to the presidency here must be seriously rich.
sentence.Network_cn: 要想当这儿的主席一定要家财万贯。

sentence.Network_en: They appeal to and are priced for, India's aspirant middle class.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们呼吁为中产阶级定价.

sentence.Network_en: Responsible, aspirant, have a good character, best engage in trade business.
sentence.Network_cn: 重情,品德好, 成熟稳重,负责任, 有事业基础, 最好是从事外贸行业的男士.

list.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... asperse v 洒水；诽谤（a坏+ aspire v 热望；立志（a加强+ spirit 精神） "267.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent. (as a noun): from Latin aspirant- 'aspiring', from the verb aspirare (see aspire)

entry.tran: 有抱负者；（政治权力或重要职位的）追求者；雄心勃勃的人
entry.def: Someone who is an aspirant to political power or to an important job has a strong desire to achieve it.

example.ex: Any aspirant to the presidency here must be seriously rich...
example.tran: 要想当这儿的主席一定要家财万贯。

entry.def: Aspirant means the same as aspiring .

means.word_mean: 1. an ambitious and aspiring young person;

sentences.sentence: "the audience was full of Madonna wannabes"

means.word_mean: 2. desiring or striving for recognition or advancement

auth_sentence.content: Degrade me...To an aspirant after fame, not truth!
auth_sentence.res_content: Degrade me...To an aspirant after fame, not truth!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Degrade me...To an aspirant after fame, not truth!

auth_sentence.content: For an aspirant advocate the appeal of being part of that system, working at the sharp end of the law, is often irresistible.
auth_sentence.res_content: For an aspirant advocate the appeal of being part of that system, working at the sharp end of the law, is often irresistible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For an aspirant advocate the appeal of being part of that system, working at the sharp end of the law, is often irresistible.

auth_sentence.content: Murray's victory in the US Open means that he must be judged not as an aspirant, but as a champion.
auth_sentence.res_content: Murray's victory in the US Open means that he must be judged not as an aspirant, but as a champion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Murray's victory in the US Open means that he must be judged not as an aspirant, but as a champion.
